title: Album Page, "Fountain, Perugia", March 7, 1890
medium: Graphite on off-white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: approximately one inch from bottom of sheet, read upside down and in reverse (watermark in all capital letters): ...ON & MONTGOLEIE...
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 103; below drawing: fountain Perugia - 1890 March 7th / the basin very shallow - not deeper than 3 inches / red marble column and red panels; at bottom right edge: 1943-51-169.
dimensions: 15.3 x 13.2 cm (6 x 5 3/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.9 cm (12 9/16 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular
description: Sheet cut down to a vertical rectangle depicting a fountain in elevation.  The basin consists of two plinths.  The fountain spouts water from three sides of a column, upon which rests another smaller basin.  At the top is a small figure that spouts water.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Fountain, Perugia", March 7, 1890.
March 7, 1890. Graphite on off-white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-169.
